page.title: 18A St.Alban's Wood in July.
page.content: {Batchwood,}a mixed deciduous wood, is on the urban fringe on the{north {west}side of St.Albans.In the wood, some{old trees}have been{replaced}by new ones and now some{flowers}are growing there in the sunlight.Deep in the wood there is no light and so most flowers do not grow,but even if there's a glimmer of light they shoot up. We found many different types of flowers,including broom,vetch,thistle, elderberry,buttercup,redclover,rosebay willow herb,greater willow herb,wild rose,raspberry,blackberry,dead nettle,stinging nettle and woody nightshade. In the{Spring}the wood has a mass of bluebells.We did not see many birds,but we heard a chaffinch,a woodpigeon,a thrush and a blackbird. The wood is used for{recreation,dog {walking}and{nature study.
